item.title: The Leaked Synopsis Of The Next Life Is Strange Has Me Worried
item.content:encoded:
Life Is Strange: Double Exposure, the latest game in the narrative-driven adventure game series, ended on a cliffhanger in 2024. It’s little surprise, then, that despite some strife at developer Deck Nine Games, it seems–based on a leaked PEGI rating that has been since yoinked off the rating board’s official site–to be getting a sequel. Despite Square Enix’s efforts to plug the leak, the internet remembers all, so we know the game is apparently going to be called Life Is Strange: Reunion, and we also know a bit about the game’s premise thanks to an accompanying synopsis. Some folks are probably celebrating what Reunion might entail, but I have questions.

The full summary that was removed from the PEGI site reads as follows:

Chloe Price was Max Caulfield’s partner in time… Losing her is Max’s greatest regret. Now Chloe has come to Caledon University. Haunted by nightmares and impossible memories, Chloe needs Max’s help. But Max is already in crisis: in three days, a deadly inferno will destroy the campus.

So there’s a lot to unpack in these few sentences, but to get the obvious out of the way, the “reunion” the game’s title seems to refer to is one between Max and Chloe, the two leads of the original Life Is Strange. At the end of that game, you make a choice that either sees Chloe die or sees the two ride off to an unknown future together, though if you choose the latter, the events of Double Exposure find the two characters taking some time apart. The decision was unpopular with long-time fans, but Double Exposure did suggest that the two may reunite down the line, and even if I was bummed that Chloe wasn’t in the game, I admired Double Exposure’s commitment to respecting both endings of the original. Now, however, it sounds like Chloe will be part of Reunion, perhaps regardless of whatever the player did in the 2015 original?

The fact that Deck Nine had players import the Chloe choice into Double Exposure through an early dialogue option makes me hopeful the team isn’t just throwing away the possibility that Chloe died at the end of the first game in reaction to the backlash it got for omitting Max’s foul-mouthed, punk rock best (girl)friend. The line in the synopsis about Chloe being “haunted by nightmares and impossible memories” makes me wonder if some time travel nonsense could be used to make Chloe show up in Reunion even if you did choose the ending in which she dies. Perhaps these “impossible memories” are ones involving both versions of events? Double Exposure has a lot of timeline jumping; maybe this could have affected Chloe as a character existing in many quantum states due to Max’s time traveling?

Whatever the case, games that undermine player choice are a pet peeve of mine, which is a big reason why I’m anxious about Mass Effect 5. There are a lot of fans who would be content if BioWare just declared one of the original trilogy’s final decisions canon and picked it up from there, so it seems like a real possibility, but I’m not one of them. It was encouraging to see Deck Nine make a big hoopla of maintaining Life Is Strange’s continuity in Double Exposure, and I hope the team has put in the effort to carry it through to Reunion as well. Hopefully we don’t have to wait too long to find out more about this game. The thought of speculating about this for several months is already making my head hurt.



https://kotaku.com/life-is-strange-5-reunion-chloe-max-summary-plot-leak-2000658198
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Jackass 5 Is Happening Later This Year
item.content:encoded:
There is still some good left in this world. We’re getting a new, still officially untitled, Jackass, and we don’t have to wait a decade like last time. The new comedy is set to arrive in June.

On January 8, Jackass ringleader Johnny Knoxville posted the iconic skull and crutches logo for the franchise on Instagram, with the date June 26 below it. In the text for the post, he confirmed that, yes, a new Jackass movie is a go. Expect lots of wild stunts, gross moments, and of course, some injuries.

“Well, a wang dang and hot damn doodle, we are starting the year off with a bang,” said Knoxville on Instagram. “We wanted to let you know that this summer, Jackass is back!! We will see you in theatres June 26th. More to come, but wanted you to hear it from us first!”

That’s all the official information we have at the moment. We don’t know who is returning or which guest stars will be making an appearance in the upcoming comedy flick. In the last movie, 2022’s Jackass Forever, most of the original Jackass crew from the 2000s era TV show on MTV returned, with the notable exceptions of Bam Margera and Ryan Dunn. Margera has struggled with substance abuse issues for years, and while sober now, has had a rocky relationship with the Jackass crew and is likely not returning in the next film. Dunn sadly died in 2011. His last Jackass movie was 2010’s Jackass 3. For Jackass Forever, the crew also added some younger talent to help out. No word if they will be returning this time around.

The Jackass franchise is a big success for Paramount, with the four main films, and the Bad Grandpa spin-off, bringing in over $560 million worldwide at the box office on relatively tiny budgets. There was even a Jackass video game released in 2007. It was bad. Don’t play it. 



https://kotaku.com/jackass-5-is-happening-later-this-year-2000658174
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: UGREEN’s USB-C Hub Drops Below $10, This 5-in-1 Adapter Is Selling Out Fast on Amazon
item.content:encoded:
Do you find yourself routinely trying to improve your computer setup, but you have too many cables to make it feasible? You might want to think about getting a multiport. They’re affordable, and thanks to the deal we’ve located, you can get one even cheaper than usual. Plus, you can set up your workstation using just a single USB-C port.

Get the UGREEN USB C Hub 5 in 1 Multiport at Amazon for only $9.99 (from $15.99), which is a $6 discount and approximately 38% in savings. For this price, you can buy a few and change up all your computer stations just for the sake of keeping things consistent.

See at Amazon

An affordable way to improve your compact PC setup

Here’s how it works. This multi-port adapter instantly adds additional ports to your existing device’s USB-C port when plugged in. When connected via USB-C you can add peripherals like a keyboard, a mouse, a flash drive or external hard drive to your central device, all without needing to swap cables every few minutes. It can essential help turn thin laptops and tablets into more powerful desktop setups when needed. For example, it’s useful whether you’re moving between a home office, a classroom or coffee shop.

Alternatively, you can connect your device to a monitor, television or projector for a better viewing experience on a larger screen. This is beneficial for watching movies on a larger screen, displaying slides in a professional environment or extending your display to keep multiple windows open simultaneously.

As compact as they are, most hubs are designed to direct cable flow away from your hands to maintain a clean and organized workspace. The small and lightweight design of the UGREEN USB C Hub 5 in 1 Multiport makes it easy to fit into a laptop case or backpack pocket and allows you to take it wherever you go without giving it a second thought. Most importantly, this is the type of accessory you’ll likely forget about until you truly need a USB port or an external display, and then you’ll be happy it is available.

We’ve lined out the reasons why, so it’s probably obvious by now, but this USB-C hub can make for a super useful gift or addition to anyone’s PC setup. It’s a practical and affordable upgrade that gives you plenty of space to work with when it comes to compact setups. And perhaps most importantly, it’s just $9.99. That’s super affordable, and well worth picking up whether you shop for yourself or others as a gift. Anyone can appreciate the gift of efficiency, especially in a world where complex computing can be the norm.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/ugreens-usb-c-hub-drops-below-10-this-5-in-1-adapter-is-selling-out-fast-on-amazon-2000657275

item.title: HP Rolls Out Another Laptop Deal at 65% Off, Ryzen 5 EliteBook G1 16″ Windows 11 Pro PC (16GB RAM, 512GB SSD)
item.content:encoded:
Grabbing a new laptop does not have to blow your budget if you know where to look. If your current machine isn’t offering the performance it once did, or your needs have grown, and you want something with a bit more muscle, Amazon is making the upgrade easy.

The retailer is currently offering a massive 65% discount on the 16-inch HP EliteBook 6 G1, which brings its price down to $900 from $2,600. You’re saving a whopping $1,700 on a device that’s made to handle both work and entertainment well, but the deal wraps up soon. Snag the drop before that happens!

See at Amazon

Efficient Performance for All Your Tasks

The HP EliteBook 6 G1a is the successor to the top-rated EliteBook 665. This machine runs on the fast and efficient AMD Ryzen 5 220 processor with a 3.2GHz base clock, boost speeds up to 4.9GHz, six cores, and 16MB of L3 cache. It’s made to handle everyday workloads, plus some resource-intensive tasks with ease. The processor is paired with a modest 16GB DDR5 SDRAM memory, which makes it easy to juggle multiple tasks at once without experiencing noticeable slowdowns. You will be able to use multiple tabs, work on a few different programs, take quick work calls, and more – with ease. Storage-wise, you’re covered with a spacious 512GB SSD, which offers enough space to keep all your important documents, media files, applications, and even games in a single place.

The display here is a stunning 16-inch diagonal WUXGA (1920×1200) UWVA IPS screen that delivers impressive visuals consistently. Expect vivid details, vibrant colors, and a sharp picture clarity, whether you’re working on a creative project or just catching up with friends on a video call. Speaking of video calls, the built-in 5MP camera paired with Poly Studio tuned speakers with AI Noise Reduction makes those a breeze. You will look your best, plus be heard properly as well. What’s more, 400 nits of brightness, paired with the anti-glare coating, ensure visibility in all lighting conditions, whether you’re streaming a movie at night or working on a school assignment while soaking up some sun. Additionally, low blue light emission makes it easy to use the screen for extended periods without compromising your eye health.

Port selection is wide. We’re talking one HDMI port, one stereo headphone/microphone combo jack, one RJ-45, 1 security lock slot, two USB Type-A 5Gbps signaling rate (powered), two Thunderbolt 4 with USB Type-C 40Gbps signaling rate (USB Power Delivery 3.0, DisplayPort 2.1, HP Sleep and Charge). Wireless connectivity options include Wi-Fi 6E and Bluetooth 5.3.

Battery life is just as solid, and recharging doesn’t take forever, either. Those who often need to work on long documents will also appreciate the spill-resistant, backlit HP Standard Keyboard with numeric keypad that’s designed keeping comfort in mind. There’s also a fingerprint reader on the keyboard for secure logins.

Windows 11 Pro comes pre-installed, so there’s no need to worry about installing an operating system from scratch to get started, either. You can now grab this efficient mid-range laptop for just $900, after a whopping 65% discount at Amazon. It comes packed with a wide range of features that make it perfect for students, work professionals, and even casual users. Just be sure to grab yours before the price shoots back up to $2,600.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/hp-rolls-out-another-laptop-deal-at-65-off-ryzen-5-elitebook-g1-16-windows-11-pro-pc-16gb-ram-512gb-ssd-2000657117
